Dear Maria Elaina Lessnau:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following: (c)
Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety, and
supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Allegation #1: Youth A and Youth B are youth at Christ Child
House. Youth B is cognitively impaired and Youth A has anger
issues, ADD, ADHD and ODD. On 11/09/2024 at 9pm, the two
youth entered a two-sided bathroom at the home on opposite
sides. Staff were sitting outside of the bathroom door to provide
supervision, and three remaining staff were standing in the same
hallway. Staff did not provide proper supervision and could be
seen on their cell phone. While the youth were in the bathroom
they engaged in inappropriate sexual activity. One of the youth
could be heard laughing on one side of the bathroom, while the
other did not say anything. No other children were present. Youth
A and Youth B were in the bathroom for 30 seconds before
exiting. They both went back to their bedrooms. The youth are not
afraid of each other. The safety plan is to separate the youth, and
they will not remain in the same group.
Allegation #2: Agency staff failed to follow 2nd Shift guidelines as
required. Youth are up at 9pm, which was after scheduled
bedtime.
Allegation #3: Staff failed to complete required supervision
checks every 10 minutes as required per agency policy.
Investigation Allegation #1
Interviews:
On 11/13/2024 an in-person interview was completed with
assigned Foster Care Worker (FCW) for Youth A. at the local
DHHS office.

On 11/15/2024 an onsite visit was completed at Christ Child
House (CCH). An interview was completed with Chief
Administrator and Residential Coordinator. They both were
advised of the allegations involving Youth A and Youth B. They
confirmed knowledge of the incident and advised that it occurred
on Saturday 11/9/24. The incident was reported on 11/10/24 and a
report to DHHS was made. Youth A was taken to Henry Ford
Hospital-Fairlane for an evaluation. Residential Coordinator
reported that Youth A told Staff 6 and Staff 2 that Youth B put his

He also refused medical treatment and forensic exam. An

went to the restroom area to provide increased supervision since
two youth were in the restroom. She further advised that the youth
are no longer in the same group as a part of a safety plan. She
confirmed that every youth has their own bedroom in the program.
On 12/05/2024 additional interviews were completed with Chief
Administrator and Residential Coordinator. Video footage of the
incident was shown in its entirety to myself and the DHHS
Specialist. Residential Coordinator again confirmed that the
agency has a no cell phone policy while at work.
On 11/15/2024 an in-person interview was held with Youth B at

He stated the third boy was Youth C but denied that he did “nasty

On 11/19/2024 an email correspondence was received from

On 11/21/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
A at Turning Point School. Assigned DHHS Specialist was also

months and is in the 7th Grade. He stated that he “likes” it at CCH.
When asked how well he got along with staff, he replied “medium”
and described that as meaning that sometimes he gets along with

with other youth at the facility. Youth A went on to share
information about rules that youth have to follow relative to using
the bathroom at CCH, which included that two youth could not be
in the bathroom at the same time. He reported that staff normally
come in the bathroom when they are in there to monitor. He
confirmed that each stall has a door, so they still have privacy.
Youth A shared that he and Youth B were in the bathroom
together. He reported there was a staff person in the bathroom
with them but could not remember the name of the staff. He
denied that he and Youth B were in the same stall and stated they
were just using the bathroom. He denied that he and Youth B
touched each other’s bodies and reported that they had their
clothes on. Youth A denied that they ever took any of their clothes

recall if the staff that he reported was in the bathroom with them

bathroom with Youth B with any of CCH staff. He reported that he

The following interviews took place on 12/05/2024 at CCH
along with DHHS specialist, unless otherwise noted.
Staff 4 was interviewed. He reported that he has been employed
at Christ Child House for 4 years as a Youth Specialist/Youth
Coordinator. He recalled working on 11/9/24 and has seen the
video footage from this day. He recalled that he came upstairs
around 8:40pm, did room checks and did not see Youth B. He
asked other staff where Youth B was and Staff 3 said he was in
his room. Staff 4 stated that he then looked in the room again
using the flashlight on his phone and looking under the bed and
did not see him. He then heard some noise coming from the
bathroom close to the bedroom and asked who was in there.
Youth B responded it was him. Staff 4 then adjusted his
monitoring chair so that he could see inside the bathroom. Staff 4
4

reported that a little later, he saw Youth A come out of nowhere
and was not aware he came out of the bathroom until he watched
the video footage. He reported that Youth A said that Youth B
called him in the bathroom and wanted him to come and penetrate

reported that staff are to monitor youth when they are showering

should be in the bathroom together. He reported that prior to this

did look at his phone and saw on the video footage that other staff
were on their phone as well. Staff 4 reported that direct
supervision was not being provided to the youth. He also
confirmed knowing of some history of sexualized behaviors with
the youth but did not have knowledge of any acting out on anyone
at the facility. He denied there being any plans surrounding
specific supervision of the boys prior to this incident.
Staff 3 was interviewed. She has been employed at Christ Child
House for 4 years as a Youth Specialist. She recalled hearing that
there was some type of incident between Youth A and Youth B
involving a MP3 player and she heard they were in the bathroom
for a long time. She denied knowledge of policy regarding how
long youth can remain in the bathroom but acknowledge that there
should only be one youth in the bathroom at a time. Staff 3
recalled working on 11/09/2024. She reported she came upstairs
and Staff 2 was on the far end of the hallway and Staff 1 was on
the short end of the hallway. She reported that she came and sat
midway in the hallway against the wall. She denied knowledge
that any youth were in the restroom. She reported seeing Youth B
come out of the bathroom, but never saw Youth A. She denied
being on her cell phone and denied seeing any other staff
members on their cell phone. She reported that she did not do any
room checks during the time she was sitting in the hallway. She
confirmed that room checks are supposed to be done every 10
minutes. Inquiry was held as to if she was distracted, and she
indicated that she did have her music on. She first said she had

cell phones on the floor. Staff 2 reported that she had heard that
Youth A reported something about Youth B putting his “dick in his
ass” but Youth B responded that he did not do that. That was all

Staff 1 was interviewed. She has been employed at Christ Child
House as a Youth Specialist for over a year. Staff 1 reported that

Staff 2 was interviewed. He reported that he has been employed

Youth C was interviewed. He denied being in the bathroom alone

The bathroom was observed to have 2 entry doorways and when

On 12/17/2024 a telephone interview was held with Staff 5. The

6

information to report. She reported that on the night in question

On 12/18/2024 DHHS Pre Disposition meeting was held via

Area Manager were present. It was later determined that DHHS
had findings.
Video Review:
Christ Child House surveillance video dated 11/09/2024 was
viewed. Starting at 8:15 p.m. Staff 1 and Staff 2 were observed
sitting on opposite ends of the hallways. At 8:15 p.m. Youth B was
observed to go into the bathroom. Staff 2 could be seen looking at
his cellphone. Staff 1’s back was turned to the camera so it could
not be seen what she was doing. At 8:21 p.m. Staff 3 came
upstairs and sat in the middle of the hallway along the wall. At
8:30 p.m. Youth A was observed going into the bathroom. Youth B
was still in the bathroom at this time. No staff members were
observed to go into bathroom during this time. Staff 2 was
observed still at the other end of the hallway looking at his phone.
Other youth began coming upstairs about 8:31 p.m. and heading
to their rooms. No other youth were observed going into the
bathroom at this time. Staff 5 was observed coming upstairs with
laundry at 8:35 p.m. (she was only present for approximately 2
minutes and was not observed on her phone). Staff 4 was
observed coming upstairs at 8:41 p.m. and he began looking in
some youth rooms appearing to be doing checks. He sat down in
a chair along the wall in the middle of the hallway. Both Staff 4
and Staff 1 were observed on their phones. Youth B was observed
to exit the bathroom at 8:43 p.m. and went to his room. Youth A
was observed to exit the bathroom at 8:46 p.m.
7

Documents Reviewed:
Christ Child House Cell Phone Policy: Employees are required to
assure that when they are on duty their cell phones are not
disruptive. Employees are not allowed to use their cell phone
while on duty and should use their break to return calls or text
messages. Employees are not to be watching videos, television
shows or movies; they are not to be on social media sites;
accessing emails or any other website while they are working.
Bluetooth/hands-free devices are not to be used on the premises.
Allegation #2
Interviews:
On 12/05/2024 an in-person interview was held with Staff 2 at
Christ Child House. He confirmed that on the evening of the
incident youth were up beyond the 8pm time indicated for “lights
out” on the agency schedule.
Video Reviewed:
Christ Child House surveillance video dated 11/09/2024 was
viewed and youth were seen to be up after the agency bedtime of
8:30/9:00 pm. The video footage showed Youth A went into the
bathroom at 8:15pm and Youth B went in at 8:30pm. Youth B
exited the bathroom at 8:43pm and Youth A exited the bathroom
at 8:46pm.
Documents reviewed:
A copy of the 2nd shift Guidelines for Christ Child House was
reviewed and indicated that youth under the age of 14 go to bed
(lights out) at 8:30. It was noted that both Youth A and Youth B
are both under the age of 14. Both Youth A and Youth B are 12
years old.
Allegation #3
Interview:
On 12/05/2024 an in-person interview was completed with Chief
Administrator and Residential Coordinator at Christ Child
House. Both confirmed that review of the video and agency
interviews of staff involved confirmed that staff failed to make the
policy required 10-minute checks.
On 12/05/2024 in-person interviews were completed with Staff 1,
Staff 2, Staff 3 and Staff 4 at Christ Child House. All staff, with
the exception of Staff 4, confirmed that they did not make room
8

checks as required per policy while upstairs on the day of the
incident. Staff 4 confirmed he did complete a bed check, which
could be seen on the video footage.
Video Reviewed:
Christ Child House surveillance video dated 11/09/2024 was
viewed. During the video several 10-minute increments passed,
and staff were not observed to have completed any room and bed
checks.
Documents reviewed:
2nd shift Guidelines for Christ Child House indicate that staff are
required to complete random room checks and bed checks at
least six times throughout the hour (approximately every 10
minutes). Staff must ensure that they visually see each client;
staff must see flesh when completing all bed checks.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule 4109-1-C. There were a total
of three agency policies that the agency was found to not be
compliant with. Interviews with youth and staff documented non-
compliance regarding staff using cell phones while at work, staff
not completing required supervision checks and staff not following
shift guidelines.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Title required.
Rule Code & Rule 131: The licensee shall develop and implement a written
Section plan to assure compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA
Description 238, MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Allegation Staff failed to make an immediate report of suspected abuse or
neglect as required per agency policy.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/05/2024 an in-person interview was held with Staff 2 at
Christ Child House. He reported that he was made aware of the
incident between Youth A and Youth B and the bathroom near the
end of his shift that night about 11 p.m. Staff 2 reported that Staff

On 12/05/2024 an onsite visit was completed at Christ Child

Administrator and Residential Coordinator. They were advised
that Staff 2 reported he was first informed about the incident
between Youth A and Youth B at about 10:30/11:00pm on
11/09/2024.
Documents Reviewed:
Christ Child House Incident Report – IR is dated for 11/10/2024
and indicates time of incident as 1:00pm. The report indicates
that upon arrival to work, Staff 2 spoke with Youth A and Youth B.
It was reported that Youth A stated he was in the shower stall and
Youth B asked him if he could stick his penis in his ass and Youth
A responded yes. Staff 2 further documented after speaking with
Youth B, he stated “I am going to tell the truth. I did stick my dick
in his ass and he let me”. It is noted that the IR is dated for
11/10/2024 and the alleged incident occurred on 11/09/2024.
DHS 3200 Form Report of Actual or Suspected Child Abuse or
Neglect – Form is dated for 11/10/2024 and was faxed over at
5:34pm (according to time stamp). The allegations are noted as
Youth A alleges that Youth B stuck his penis in his rectum”.
CCH Compliance with the CHILD PROTECTION LAW Act 238 of
1975 Policy – Policy indicates that mandated reporters are
required to make an immediate verbal report to CPS and a written
report within 72 hours when they suspect child abuse or neglect.
Mandated reporters must also notify the head of their organization
of the report. Reporting the suspected allegations of child abuse
and/or neglect to the head of the organization does not fulfill the
requirement to report directly to MDHHS. Policy defines all Christ
Child House staff as mandated reporters. The verbal report can
be completed by calling 855-444-3911.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule 400.4131. The agency
failed to follow policy relevant to immediate mandated reporting of
suspected child abuse and neglect.
Conclusion Violation Established
